articles.headline: From Annapolis to Congress? These Three Women Know Tough Missions
articles.snippet: The women, who were contemporaries at the Naval Academy, are part of a powerful wave of political activism in the era of President Trump.
articles.abstract: The women, who were contemporaries at the Naval Academy, are part of a powerful wave of political activism in the era of President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: NORFOLK, Va. — Elaine Luria commanded an assault ship with a crew of 400 that patrolled the Persian Gulf for hostile Iranian vessels. Amy McGrath was the first female Marine to fly in an F-18 fighter jet in combat, dropping bombs over Afghanistan and Iraq. Mikie Sherrill was certified as a Navy helicopter pilot only after passing an underwater crash simulation in which she was blindfolded, turned upside down, and forced to find the sole exit door.

articles.headline: Taunted by Trump and Pressured From Above, McCabe Steps Down as F.B.I. Deputy
articles.snippet: Andrew G. McCabe’s retirement had been expected, but Monday’s departure was abrupt and unannounced. Republicans have accused Mr. McCabe of being loyal to Hillary Clinton.
articles.abstract: Andrew G. McCabe’s retirement had been expected, but Monday’s departure was abrupt and unannounced. Republicans have accused Mr. McCabe of being loyal to Hillary Clinton.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Andrew G. McCabe abruptly stepped down on Monday as the F.B.I.’s deputy director after months of withering criticism from President Trump, telling friends he felt pressure from the head of the bureau to leave, according to two people close to Mr. McCabe.
articles.byline: By Adam Goldman and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: Tucked Into the Tax Bill, a Plan to Help Distressed America
articles.snippet: A little-noticed provision in the tax law seeks to drive investment to parts of the country that are still waiting for the economic recovery to arrive.
articles.abstract: A little-noticed provision in the tax law seeks to drive investment to parts of the country that are still waiting for the economic recovery to arrive.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A little-noticed section in the $1.5 trillion tax cut that President Trump signed into law late last month is drawing attention from venture capitalists, state government officials and mayors across America.

articles.headline: Janet Yellen’s Fitting Finale: Fed Plans to Stand Still
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve is expected to leave interest rates unchanged at Janet L. Yellen’s final meeting as the Fed chairwoman. Harder choices lie ahead.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve is expected to leave interest rates unchanged at Janet L. Yellen’s final meeting as the Fed chairwoman. Harder choices lie ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve’s departing chairwoman, will preside over her final policymaking meeting on Tuesday and Wednesday where, in a fitting finale, the Fed is expected to leave its benchmark interest rate unchanged as the economy continues to gain strength.

articles.headline: Tronc Names New Editors at The Daily News and The Los Angeles Times
articles.snippet: The company brings in two veteran editors, Jim Kirk and Jim Rich, to quiet newsroom complaints that have threatened to seep across the company.
articles.abstract: The company brings in two veteran editors, Jim Kirk and Jim Rich, to quiet newsroom complaints that have threatened to seep across the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: The embattled newspaper company Tronc moved Monday to calm rising tensions at publications on both coasts, announcing that it had named new top editors at The Los Angeles Times and The New York Daily News.

articles.headline: Attacks Reveal What U.S. Won’t: Victory Remains Elusive in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: In his State of the Union address, President Trump is expected to promote his strategy to win the war in Afghanistan. He’ll be the third president to do so.
articles.abstract: In his State of the Union address, President Trump is expected to promote his strategy to win the war in Afghanistan. He’ll be the third president to do so.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Taliban are in retreat, the Afghan military is on the brink of assuming control of the country, and the government in Kabul is one step away from being able to provide security across the land. So three successive presidential administrations have said over 16 years about the war in Afghanistan.

articles.headline: House Republicans Vote to Release Secret Memo on Russia Inquiry
articles.snippet: Disregarding Justice Department warnings, the House Intelligence Committee will release a secret memo questioning the origins of the Russia investigation.
articles.abstract: Disregarding Justice Department warnings, the House Intelligence Committee will release a secret memo questioning the origins of the Russia investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Republicans on the House Intelligence Committee, disregarding Justice Department warnings that their actions would be “extraordinarily reckless,” voted Monday evening to release a contentious secret memorandum said to accuse the department and the F.B.I. of misusing their authority to obtain a secret surveillance order on a former Trump campaign associate.

articles.headline: For His Next Act, Ken Chenault Turns His Focus on Silicon Valley
articles.snippet: Seeing an opportunity to have a larger impact on Silicon Valley and its business culture, Mr. Chenault plans to join the venture capital firm General Catalyst Partners.
articles.abstract: Seeing an opportunity to have a larger impact on Silicon Valley and its business culture, Mr. Chenault plans to join the venture capital firm General Catalyst Partners.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ever since Kenneth I. Chenault announced last fall that he would retire as chief executive of American Express, he has been fielding phone calls from companies looking to hire him.

articles.headline: Kodak’s Dubious Cryptocurrency Gamble
articles.snippet: What’s a 130-year-old photo company doing dabbling in cryptocurrency? Either revolutionizing digital rights management or trying to make a quick buck.
articles.abstract: What’s a 130-year-old photo company doing dabbling in cryptocurrency? Either revolutionizing digital rights management or trying to make a quick buck.
articles.lead_paragraph: An eon or two ago, Eastman Kodak was a bleeding-edge technology company. It hired the smartest engineers and put them to work racking up patents, pioneering new chemical processes and building a globe-spanning camera and film business that, at its peak, employed 145,000 people.

articles.headline: Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Team Up to Try to Disrupt Health Care
articles.snippet: The three companies will create a new venture with the goal of simplifying coverage for their employees, in a move that unsettled the health care world.
articles.abstract: The three companies will create a new venture with the goal of simplifying coverage for their employees, in a move that unsettled the health care world.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Three corporate behemoths — Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase — announced on Tuesday that they would form an independent health care company for their employees in the United States.
articles.byline: By Nick Wingfield, Katie Thomas and Reed Abelson

articles.headline: Is the Populist Revolt Over? Not if Robots Have Their Way
articles.snippet: Job-killing imports from China gave rise to the dynamics that led to President Trump’s election. Artificial intelligence could provide the next wave.
articles.abstract: Job-killing imports from China gave rise to the dynamics that led to President Trump’s election. Artificial intelligence could provide the next wave.
articles.lead_paragraph: Does President Trump represent the new normal in American politics?

articles.headline: Volkswagen Suspends Top Lobbyist Amid Inquiry Into Diesel Tests on Monkeys
articles.snippet: Thomas Steg, a former top aide to Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, exemplified what critics say are the cozy ties between her government and the country’s carmakers.
articles.abstract: Thomas Steg, a former top aide to Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, exemplified what critics say are the cozy ties between her government and the country’s carmakers.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Volkswagen suspended its chief lobbyist on Tuesday amid a growing furor over experiments on monkeys that were meant to promote the virtues of diesel-powered vehicles, but now threaten to further undermine the German car industry and to increase political instability in Berlin.
